page.title: 14HISTORIC HOUSES IN GRIMLEY
page.content: Thorngrove was built in the late 18th century. It has a bathstone front with stone framed windows and one front door. The present owners Mr.& Mrs G.Hickton bought Thorngrove in 1981. The stables have been converted into cottages. Notable occupants include Lucien Bonaparte, younger brother of Napole- an, who came to the house in 1811 as a prisoner of war. Sir Samuel Baker liv- ed at Thorngrove. He discovered Lake Albert Nyanza a source of the River Nile.He died in 1893 and his ashes in- terned in the family tomb at Grimley. The Dallows, formerly Ivy House, is a part brick and part timber-framed house. The rear is probably late Eliz- abethan and the brick front circa 1700. It was a farmhouse. Twenty years ago the ivy was taken off and a Georg- ian front doorway inserted.
